<p>
HEADQUARTERS MILITARY DIVISION OF THE MISSISSIPPI, 
</p><p>
IN THE FIELD NEAR <a href="http://www.familytales.org/results.php?city=columbia" rel="city">Columbia</a>, S.C., Feb. 16, <a href="http://www.familytales.org/results.php?year=1865">1865</a>. 
</p><p>
Special Field Orders, No. 26.

[EXTRACT] 
</p><p>
The next series of movements will be at Fayetteville, 
N.C., and thence to Wilmington or Goldsboro, according 
to events. Great care must be taken to collect forage 
and food, and at the same time in covering the wagon 
trains from cavalry dashes. 
</p><p>
General Howard will cross the Saluda and Broad 
rivers as near their mouths as possible, occupy <a href="http://www.familytales.org/results.php?city=columbia" rel="city">Columbia</a>, destroy the public buildings, railroad property, manufacturing and machine shops, but will spare libraries, 
and asylums, and private dwellings. He will then move 
to Winnsboro, destroying en route utterly that section 
of the railroad. . . . 
</p><p>
By order of Major-General 
</p><p>
<a href="http://www.familytales.org/results.php?tla=wts" rel="me">W. T. SHERMAN</a>. 
</p>
